arabicText: ۞ تِلْكَ ٱلرُّسُلُ فَضَّلْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍۢ ۘ مِّنْهُم مَّن كَلَّمَ ٱللَّهُ ۖ وَرَفَعَ بَعْضَهُمْ دَرَجَـٰتٍۢ ۚ وَءَاتَيْنَا عِيسَى ٱبْنَ مَرْيَمَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَأَيَّدْنَـٰهُ بِرُوحِ ٱلْقُدُسِ ۗ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا ٱقْتَتَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتُ وَلَـٰكِنِ ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فَمِنْهُم مَّنْ ءَامَنَ وَمِنْهُم مَّن كَفَرَ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا ٱقْتَتَلُوا۟ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَفْعَلُ مَا يُرِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	the	Noble	Messengers,	to	whom	
We	 gave	 excellence	 over	 each	 other;	 of	
them	 are	 some	 with	 whom	 Allah spoke,	
and	some	whom	He	exalted	high	above	all	
others;	and	We	gave	 Eisa	(Jesus),	 the	 son	
of	Maryam,	clear	signs	and	We	aided	him	
with	 the	 Holy	 Spirit;	 and	 if	 Allah willed,	
those	 after	 them	 would	 not	 have	 fought	
each	 other	 after	 the	 clear	 evidences	 had	
come	 to	 them,	 but	 they	 differed	 - some	
remained	 on	 faith	 and	 some	 turned	
disbelievers;	 and	 had	 Allah willed,	 they	
would	 not	 have	 fought	 each	 other;	 but	
Allah may	do	as	He	wills
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	Rasool	haiñ	ke	ham	ne	in	meiñ	ek	ko	
doosre	par	Afzal	kiya	in	meiñ	kisi	se	Allah	
ne	kalām	farmāya	aur	koi	woh	hai	jise	sab	
par	 darjoñ	 balañd	 kiya	 aur	 ham	 ne	
Maryam ke	 bete	 ‘Isā ko	 khuli	 nishāniyān	
deeiñ	aur	Pakeezah	Rooh se	uski	madad	ki	
aur	Allah	chāhta to	unke	b’ad	wāle	āapas	
meiñ	na	ladte	b’ad		iske	ke	unke	pās	khuli	
nishāniyāñ	 āa	 chukieñ	 lekin	 woh	 to	
mukhtalif	 ho	 gye	 un	 meiñ	 koi	 Imān	 par	
raha	 aur	 koi	 kāfir	 ho	 gaya	 aur	 Allah	
chāhta	 to	 woh	 na	 ladte	 magar	 Allah	 jo	
chāheñ	kare	.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَنفِقُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰكُم مِّن قَبْلِ أَن يَأْتِىَ يَوْمٌۭ لَّا بَيْعٌۭ فِيهِ وَلَا خُلَّةٌۭ وَلَا شَفَـٰعَةٌۭ ۗ وَٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Spend	 in	 Allah's	
cause,	 from	what	We	 have	 provided	 you,	
before	the	advent	of	a	day	in	which	there	
is	 no	 trade,	 and	 for	 the	 disbelievers	
neither	 any	 friendship	 nor	 intercession;	
and	 the	 disbelievers	 themselves	 are	 the	
unjust
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo!	Allah	ki	rāh	meiñ	hamāre	
diye	meiñ	se	kharch	karo	woh	din	āane	se	
pahle	jis	meiñ	 na	 khareed	 farokht	 hai	 na	
kāfiroñ	 ke	 liye	 dosti	 aur	 na	 shafa'at	 aur	
kāfir	khud	hi	zālim	haiñ

arabicText: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْحَىُّ ٱلْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُۥ سِنَةٌۭ وَلَا نَوْمٌۭ ۚ لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ مَن ذَا ٱلَّذِى يَشْفَعُ عِندَهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَىْءٍۢ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَـُٔودُهُۥ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Allah - there	is	no	God	except	Him;	He	is	
Alive	 (eternally,	 on	 His	 own)	 and	 the	
Upholder	 (keeps	 others	 established);	 He	
never	 feels	 drowsy	 nor	 does	He	 sleep;	 to	
Him	 only	 belongs	 all	 whatever	 is	 in	 the	
heavens	and	all	whatever	is	in	 the	earth;	
who	 is	 he	 that	 can	 intercede*	 with	 Him	
except	 by	His	command?	He	 knows	what	
is	in	front	of	them	and	what	is	behind	them;	and	they	do	not	achieve	anything	of	His	knowledge	
except	what	He	wills;	His	Throne	(of	Sovereignty)	encompasses	the	heavens	and	the	earth;	and	
it	is	not	difficult	for	Him	to	guard	them;	and	He	is	the	Supreme,	the	Greatest.	
(This Verse is popularly known as Ayat Al-Kursi. It has a special status and reciting it carries 
great reward. *Prophet Muhammad – peace and blessings be upon him – will be the first one 
to be granted the permission to intercede, others will follow.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	hai	jis	ke	siwa	koi	ma'bood	nahi	woh	
āap	zinda	aur	auroñ	ka	qāim	rakhne	wāla	
usey	 na	 ooñgh	 	 āaye	 na	 neeñd	 usi	 ka	 jo	
kuch	āsmanoñ	me	hai	aur	jo	kuch	zameen	
meiñ	woh	kaun	hai	jo	us	ke	yahāñ	sifārish	
kare	be	us	ke	hukm	ke	jānta	hai	jo	kuchh	
unke	 āage	 hai	 aur	 jo	 kuchh	 unke	 peeche	
aur	 woh	 nahi	 pāte	 us	 ke	 ilm	 meiñ	 se	
magar	jitna	woh	chāhe	us	ki	kursi	meiñ	samāye	huwe	haiñ	āasman	aur	zameen	aur	use	bhāri	
nahi	un	ki	nigehbāni	aur	wohi	hai	balañd	badāi	wāla
(Ye	Āyat	Āyat	al-Kursi	ke	nām	se	mashoor	hai.	Iska	apna	ek	khās	maqām	hai	or	isko	pardhna	bada	
Sawāb	hai.)

arabicText: لَآ إِكْرَاهَ فِى ٱلدِّينِ ۖ قَد تَّبَيَّنَ ٱلرُّشْدُ مِنَ ٱلْغَىِّ ۚ فَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِٱلطَّـٰغُوتِ وَيُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ فَقَدِ ٱسْتَمْسَكَ بِٱلْعُرْوَةِ ٱلْوُثْقَىٰ لَا ٱنفِصَامَ لَهَا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
There	is	no	compulsion	at	all	in	religion;	undoubtedly	the	right	path	has	become	very	distinct	
from	 error;	 and	 whoever	 rejects	 faith	 in	 the	 devil	 (false	 deities)	 and	 believes	 in	 Allah has	
grasped	a	very	firm	handhold;	it	will	never	loosen;	and	Allah is	All	Hearing,	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Kuch	zabardasti	nahi	deen	meiñ	beshak	khoob	juda	ho	gayi	hai	nek	rāh	gumrahi	se	to	jo	shaitān	
ko	na	māne	aur	Allah	par	Imān	lāye	us	ne	badi	mohkam	girah	thāmi	jise	kabhi	khulna	nahi, aur	
Allah	sunta	jānta	hai

arabicText: لَآ إِكْرَاهَ فِى ٱلدِّينِ ۖ قَد تَّبَيَّنَ ٱلرُّشْدُ مِنَ ٱلْغَىِّ ۚ فَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِٱلطَّـٰغُوتِ وَيُؤْمِنۢ بِٱللَّهِ فَقَدِ ٱسْتَمْسَكَ بِٱلْعُرْوَةِ ٱلْوُثْقَىٰ لَا ٱنفِصَامَ لَهَا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
. Allah is	 the	Guardian	of	 the	Muslims	- He	
removes	 them	 from	 realms	 of	 darkness	
towards	 light;	 and	 the	 supporters	 of	
disbelievers	 are	 the	 devils	- they	 remove	
them	 from	 light	 towards	 the	 realms	 of	
darkness;	it	is	they	who	are	the	people	of	
fire;	they	will	remain in	it	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	 wāli	 hai	 Musalmanoñ ka	 unheiñ	
andheriyoñ	 se	 noor	 ki	 taraf	 nikālta	 hai,
aur	kāfiroñ	ke	himayati	shaitān	haiñ	woh	
unheiñ	noor	se	andheriyoñ	ki	taraf	nikālte	
haiñ, yahi	 log	 dozakh	 wāle	 haiñ	 inheiñ	
hamesha	is	meiñ	rahna

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِى حَآجَّ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمَ فِى رَبِّهِۦٓ أَنْ ءَاتَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُلْكَ إِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ رَبِّىَ ٱلَّذِى يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ قَالَ أَنَا۠ أُحْىِۦ وَأُمِيتُ ۖ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِـۧمُ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأْتِى بِٱلشَّمْسِ مِنَ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ فَأْتِ بِهَا مِنَ ٱلْمَغْرِبِ فَبُهِتَ ٱلَّذِى كَفَرَ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	not	 see	
him	who	argued	with	Ibrahim	(Abraham)	
concerning	 his	 Lord,	 as	 Allah had	 given	
him	 the	 kingdom?	 When	 Ibrahim	 said,	
“My	Lord	is	He	Who	gives	life	and	causes	
death”,	he	answered,	“I	give	life	and	cause	
death”;	Ibrahim	said,	“So	indeed	it	is	Allah
Who	 brings	 the	 sun	 from	 the	 East	 - you	
bring	it	 from	 the	West!”	- the	 disbeliever	
was	 therefore	baffled;	and	Allah does	not	
guide	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Mehboob" kya	 tum	 ne	 na	 dekha	 tha	
usey	 jo	Ibrāheem se	 jhagda	 us	 ke	 rab	 ke	
bāre	 meiñ	 is	 par	 ke	 Allah	 ne	 usey	
bādshāhi	 di	 jabke	 Ibrāhēem ne	 kaha	 ke	
mera	 rab	woh	 hai	 ke	jilāta	 hai	 aur	mārta	
hai	 bola	 maiñ	 jilāta	 aur	 mārta	 hooñ	
Ibrāhēem	 ne	 farmaya	 to	 Allah	 sooraj	 ko	
lāta	 hai	 poorab	(Mashriq)	 se	 tu	 [	 us	 ko	 ]	
pach-chhim (Maghrib) se	le	āa	to	hosh	ud	
gaye	 kāfir	 ke,	 aur	 Allah	 rāh	 nahi	 dikhāta	
zālimoñ	ko.

arabicText: أَوْ كَٱلَّذِى مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍۢ وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْىِۦ هَـٰذِهِ ٱللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۖ فَأَمَاتَهُ ٱللَّهُ مِا۟ئَةَ عَامٍۢ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتَ ۖ قَالَ لَبِثْتُ يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍۢ ۖ قَالَ بَل لَّبِثْتَ مِا۟ئَةَ عَامٍۢ فَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَى ٱلْعِظَامِ كَيْفَ نُنشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكْسُوهَا لَحْمًۭا ۚ فَلَمَّا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُۥ قَالَ أَعْلَمُ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Or	 like	 him*	 who	 passed	 by	 a	 dwelling	
and	it	had	 fallen	 flat	on	its	roofs;	he	said,	
“How	 will	 Allah bring	 it	 to	 life,	 after	 its	
death?”;	 so	 Allah kept	 him	 dead	 for	 a	
hundred	 years,	 then	brought	him	back	 to	
life;	 He	 said,	 “How	 long	 have	 you	 stayed	
here?”;	he	replied,	“I	may	have	stayed	 for	
a	 day	 or	little	less”;	He	 said,	 “In	 fact,	 you	
have	 spent	 a	 hundred	 years	 - so	 look	 at	
your	food	and	drink	which	do	not	even	smell	stale;	and	look	at	your	donkey	whose	bones	even	
are	not	intact	- in	order	that	We	may	make	you	a	sign	for	mankind	- and	look	at	the	bones	how	
We	assemble	them	and	then	cover	them	with	flesh”;	so	when	the	matter	became	clear	to	him,	
he	said,	“I	know	well	that	Allah is	Able	to	do	all	things.”	(Prophet	Uzair	- peace	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ya	 uski	 tarah	 jo	 guzra	 ek	 basti	 par	 aur	
woh	dhayi	(giri)	padi	thi	apni	chatoñ	par	bola	isey	kyuñ kar	jilāye	ga	Allah	is	ki	maut	ke	b’ad	to	
Allah	ne	usey	murda	rakha	sau	baras	phir	zinda	kar	diya	farmāya	tu	yahāñ	kitna	thehra	?	Arz	ki	
din	bhar	 thehra	hoñga	 ya	kuch	kam,	 farmāya	nahi	balke	 tujhe	sau	baras	guzar	gaye	aur	apne	
khāne	aur	pāni	ko	dekh	ke	ab	 tak	boo	na	lāya	aur	apne	gadhe	ko	dekh	 (ke	jiski	haddiyāñ	 tak	
Salāmat	na	rahiñ)	aur	yeh	is	liye	ke	tujhe	hum	logoñ	ke	wāste	nishāni	kareiñ	aur	in	haddiyoñ	ko	
dekh kyuñ kar	hum	inheiñ	uthān	dete	phir	inheiñ	gosht	pahnāte	haiñ	jab	yeh	mu'āmla	us	par	
zāhir	ho	gaya	bola	maiñ	khoob	jānta	hooñ	ke	Allah	sab	kuch kar	sakta	hai.

arabicText: أَوْ كَٱلَّذِى مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍۢ وَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحْىِۦ هَـٰذِهِ ٱللَّهُ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا ۖ فَأَمَاتَهُ ٱللَّهُ مِا۟ئَةَ عَامٍۢ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُۥ ۖ قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتَ ۖ قَالَ لَبِثْتُ يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍۢ ۖ قَالَ بَل لَّبِثْتَ مِا۟ئَةَ عَامٍۢ فَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمْ يَتَسَنَّهْ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجْعَلَكَ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلنَّاسِ ۖ وَٱنظُرْ إِلَى ٱلْعِظَامِ كَيْفَ نُنشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكْسُوهَا لَحْمًۭا ۚ فَلَمَّا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُۥ قَالَ أَعْلَمُ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 Ibrahim	 said,	 “My	 Lord!	 Show	
me	how	You	will	give	life	to	the	dead”;	He	
said,	“Are	you	not	certain	(of	it)?”	Ibrahim	
said,	 “Surely	 yes,	why	 not?	 But	 because	 I	
wish	 to	 put	 my	 heart	 at	 ease”;	 He	 said,	
“Therefore	 take	 four	 birds	 (as	 pets)	 and	
cause	 them	 to	 become	 familiar	 to	 you,	
then	 place	 a	 part	 of	 each	 of	 them	 on	
separate	 hills,	 then	 call	 them	 - they	 will	
come	 running	 towards	 you;	 and	 know	
well	 that	 Allah is	 Almighty,	 Wise.”	
(Prophet	Ibrahim	called	the	dead	birds	and	
they	did	come	running	towards	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	arz	ki	Ibrāheem ne	aey	rab	mere	!	
mujhe	dikha	de	 tu	 kyuñ	 kar	murde	jilāye	
ga	 farmāya	 kya	 tujhe	 yaqeen	 nahi	 arz	 ki	
yaqeen	kyuñ	nahi	magar	yeh	chāhta	hooñ	
ke	 mere	 dil	 ko	 qarār	 āa	 jāye	 farmāya	 to	
achha	chār	parinde	lekar	apne	sāth	hila	le	
phir	unka	ek	ek	tukda	har	pahād	par	rakh	
de	 phir	 unheiñ	 bula	 woh	 tere	 pās	 chale	
āyeñge	 pāoñ	 se	 daudte	 aur	 jān	 rakh	 ke	
Allah	ghalib	hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: مَّثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ كَمَثَلِ حَبَّةٍ أَنۢبَتَتْ سَبْعَ سَنَابِلَ فِى كُلِّ سُنۢبُلَةٍۢ مِّا۟ئَةُ حَبَّةٍۢ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يُضَـٰعِفُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
The	 example	 of	 those	 who	 spend	 their	
wealth	in	Allah’s	way	is	similar	to	that	of	a	
grain	which	has	sprouted	seven	stalks	and	
in	 each	 stalk	 are	 a	 hundred	 grains;	 and	
Allah may	increase	it	still	more	 than	 this,	
for	whomever	He	wills;	and	Allah is	Most	
Capable,	All	Knowing
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	 ki	 kahāwat	 jo	 apne	 māl	 Allah	 ki	 rāh	
meiñ	 kharch	 karte	 haiñ	 us	 dāne	 ki	 tarah	
jis	 ne	 ugāyiñ	 sāt	 bāleiñ	 har	 bāl	meiñ	 sau	
dāne	aur	Allah	is	se	bhi	ziyāda	badhaye	jis	
ke	 liye	 chāhe	 aur	 Allah	 wus'at	 wāla	 ilm	
wāla	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ لَا يُتْبِعُونَ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ مَنًّۭا وَلَآ أَذًۭى ۙ لَّهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 spend	 their	 wealth	 in	 Allah’s	
way	and	thereafter	do	not	express	favour	
nor	 cause	 injury	 (hurt	 the	 recipient’s	
feelings),	 their	 reward	is	with	 their	 Lord;	
there	shall	be	no	fear	upon	them	nor	shall	
they	grieve
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	apne	māl	Allah	ki	rāh	meiñ	kharch	
karte	 haiñ	 phir	 diye	 peechhe	 na	 ahsān	
rakheiñ	 na	 takleef	 deiñ	 unka	 neg	(Ajr-oSawāb)	unke	Rab	ke	pās	hai	aur	unheiñ	na	
kuchh	andesha	ho	na	kuchh	gham.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمْ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ لَا يُتْبِعُونَ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ مَنًّۭا وَلَآ أَذًۭى ۙ لَّهُمْ أَجْرُهُمْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 spend	 their	 wealth	 in	 Allah’s	
way	and	thereafter	do	not	express	favour	
nor	 cause	 injury	 (hurt	 the	 recipient’s	
feelings),	 their	 reward	is	with	 their	 Lord;	
there	shall	be	no	fear	upon	them	nor	shall	
they	grieve
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	apne	māl	Allah	ki	rāh	meiñ	kharch	
karte	 haiñ	 phir	 diye	 peechhe	 na	 ahsān	
rakheiñ	 na	 takleef	 deiñ	 unka	 neg	(Ajr-oSawāb)	unke	Rab	ke	pās	hai	aur	unheiñ	na	
kuchh	andesha	ho	na	kuchh	gham.

arabicText: ۞ قَوْلٌۭ مَّعْرُوفٌۭ وَمَغْفِرَةٌ خَيْرٌۭ مِّن صَدَقَةٍۢ يَتْبَعُهَآ أَذًۭى ۗ وَٱللَّهُ غَنِىٌّ حَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Speaking	 kind	 words	 and	 pardoning	 are	
better	than	charity	followed	by	injury;	and	Allah is	the	Independent,	Most	Forbearing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Achchhi	bāt	kehna	aur	dar-guzar	karna	us	
khairāt	se	behtar	hai jis	ke	b’ad	satāna	ho	
aur	Allah	be	parwāh	hilm	wāla	hai	.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تُبْطِلُوا۟ صَدَقَـٰتِكُم بِٱلْمَنِّ وَٱلْأَذَىٰ كَٱلَّذِى يُنفِقُ مَالَهُۥ رِئَآءَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ ۖ فَمَثَلُهُۥ كَمَثَلِ صَفْوَانٍ عَلَيْهِ تُرَابٌۭ فَأَصَابَهُۥ وَابِلٌۭ فَتَرَكَهُۥ صَلْدًۭا ۖ لَّا يَقْدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍۢ مِّمَّا كَسَبُوا۟ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Do	not	invalidate	your	charity	by	expressing	favour	and	causing	injury	-
like	one	who	spends	his	wealth	for	people	to	see,	and	does	not	believe	in	Allah and	the	Last	Day;	
his	example	is	similar	to	that	of	a	rock	covered	with	dust	and	hard	rain	fell	on	it,	leaving	it	as	a	
bare	rock;	they	shall	get	no	control	over	(or	benefit	from)	anything	they	have	earned;	and	Allah
does	not	guide	the	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo!	Apne	Sadqe	bātil	na	kardo	ahsān	rakh	kar	aur	izā	dekar	uski	tarah	jo	apna	māl	
logoñ	ke	dikhāwe	ke	liye	kharch	kare	aur	Allah	aur	Qayamat	par	Imān	na	lāye	to	uski	kahāwat	
aisi	hai	jaise	ek	chattān	ke	us	pār	mitti	hai	ab	us	pār	zor	ka	pāni	pada	jis	ne	usey	nira	patthar	kar	
chhoda	apni	kamāyi	se	kisi	cheez	par	qābu	na		pāyeñ	ge	aur	Allah	kāfiroñ	ko	rāh	nahi	deta.

arabicText: وَمَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمْوَٰلَهُمُ ٱبْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِ ٱللَّهِ وَتَثْبِيتًۭا مِّنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ كَمَثَلِ جَنَّةٍۭ بِرَبْوَةٍ أَصَابَهَا وَابِلٌۭ فَـَٔاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا ضِعْفَيْنِ فَإِن لَّمْ يُصِبْهَا وَابِلٌۭ فَطَلٌّۭ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	example	of	those	who	spend	their	
wealth	 in	 order	 to	 seek	 Allah’s	 pleasure	
and	 to	 make	 their	 hearts	 steadfast,	 is	
similar	 to	 that	 of	 a	 garden	 on	 a	 height	 -
hard	 rain	 fell	 on	 it,	 so	 bringing	 forth	 its	
fruit	 twofold;	 so	 if	 hard	 rain	 does	 not	
reach	 it, the	 dew	 is	 enough;	 and	Allah is	
seeing	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 un	 ki	 kahāwat	 jo	 apne	 māl	 Allah	 ki	
raza	 chāhne	 meiñ	 kharch	 karte	 haiñ	 aur	
apne	dil	jamāne	ko	us	bāgh	ki	si	hai	bhood
(Rayteeli	 Zameen) par	 ho	 us	 par	 zor	 ka	
pāni	pada	to	dooney	mewe	lāya	phir	agar	
zor	ka	menh	usey	na	pahuñche	to	oas	kāfi	
hai	aur	Allah	tumhāre	kām	dekh	raha	hai

arabicText: أَيَوَدُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَن تَكُونَ لَهُۥ جَنَّةٌۭ مِّن نَّخِيلٍۢ وَأَعْنَابٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ لَهُۥ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ وَأَصَابَهُ ٱلْكِبَرُ وَلَهُۥ ذُرِّيَّةٌۭ ضُعَفَآءُ فَأَصَابَهَآ إِعْصَارٌۭ فِيهِ نَارٌۭ فَٱحْتَرَقَتْ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Would	any	of	you	like	that	he	may	own	a	
garden	 of	 dates	 and	 grapes,	 with	 rivers	
flowing	 beneath	 it	- in	 it	 are	 all	 kinds	 of	
fruits	for	him	- and	he	reaches	old	age	and	
has	 young	 children;	 therefore	 a	
windstorm	 containing	 fire	 came	 to	 the	
garden,	 burning	 it?	 This	 is	 how	 Allah
explains	 His	 verses	 to	 you,	 so	 that	 you	
may	give	thought.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiya	tum	meiñ	koi	ise	pasand	rakhe	ga	ke	
us	 ke	 pās	 ek	 bāgh	 ho	 khajooroñ	 aur	
angooroñ	 ka	 jis	 ke	 neeche	 nadiyāñ	
bahteiñ	 us	 ke	 liye	 is	 meiñ	 har	 qism	 ke	
phaloñ	se	hai	aur	usey	budhapa	āaya	aur	
us	 ke	 na-tawāñ	 bachche	 haiñ	 to	 āaya	 us	
par	 ek	 bagoola (Intehāi	 tez	 Hawā	 ka	
chakkar) jis	meiñ	āag	thi	to	jal	gya	aisa	hi	
bayān	 karta	 hai	 Allah	 tum	 se	 apni	
āayatyeñ	ke	kahiñ	tum	dhiyān	lagao

arabicText: أَيَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَنفِقُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا كَسَبْتُمْ وَمِمَّآ أَخْرَجْنَا لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَلَا تَيَمَّمُوا۟ ٱلْخَبِيثَ مِنْهُ تُنفِقُونَ وَلَسْتُم بِـَٔاخِذِيهِ إِلَّآ أَن تُغْمِضُوا۟ فِيهِ ۚ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِىٌّ حَمِيدٌ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Spend	 a	 part	 of	
your	lawful	earnings,	and	part	of	what	We	
have	 produced	 from	 the	 earth	 for	 you	 -
and	 do	 not	 (purposely)	 choose	 upon	 the	
flawed	to	give	from	it	(in	charity)	whereas	
you	would	not	accept	it	yourselves	except	
with	 your	 eyes	 closed	 towards	 it;	 and	
know	well	that	Allah is	Independent,	Most	
Praised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo	 apni	 pāk	 kamaiyoñ	 me	 se	 kuchh	 do	 aur	 us	 meiñ	 se	 jo	 ham	 ne	 tumhāre	 liye	
zameen	se	nikāla	aur	khās	nāqis	ka	irāda	na	karo	ke	do	 to	us	meiñ	se	aur	 tumheiñ	mile	 to	na	
loge	jab	tak	us	meiñ	chashm	poshi	na	karo	aur	jān	rakho	ke	Allah	be	parwāh	saraha	gaya	hai

arabicText: ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ يَعِدُكُمُ ٱلْفَقْرَ وَيَأْمُرُكُم بِٱلْفَحْشَآءِ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ يَعِدُكُم مَّغْفِرَةًۭ مِّنْهُ وَفَضْلًۭا ۗ وَٱللَّهُ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
The	 devil	 scares	 you	 of	 poverty	 and	 bids	
you	to	the	shameful;	and	Allah promises	you	forgiveness	from	Him,	and	munificence;	and	Allah
is	Most	Capable,	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Shaitān	tumheiñ	andesha	dilāta	hai	muhtāji	ka	aur	hukm	deta	hai	be	hayāi	ka	aur	aur	Allah	tum	
se	w'ada	farmāta	hai	bakhshish	aur	fazl	ka	aur	Allah	wus'at	wāla	ilm	wāla	hai

arabicText: يُؤْتِى ٱلْحِكْمَةَ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَن يُؤْتَ ٱلْحِكْمَةَ فَقَدْ أُوتِىَ خَيْرًۭا كَثِيرًۭا ۗ وَمَا يَذَّكَّرُ إِلَّآ أُو۟لُوا۟ ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
Allah bestows	 wisdom	 on	 whomever	 He	 wills;	 and	 whoever	 receives	 wisdom	 has	 received	
abundant	goodness;	but	none	heed	advice	except	men	of	understanding
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	 hikmat	 deta	 hai	jise	 chāhe	 aur	jise	 hikmat	mili	 usey	bahut	 bhalāi	mili	 aur	 nasihat	 nahi	
mānte	magar	'aql	wāle.

arabicText: وَمَآ أَنفَقْتُم مِّن نَّفَقَةٍ أَوْ نَذَرْتُم مِّن نَّذْرٍۢ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُهُۥ ۗ وَمَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ مِنْ أَنصَارٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	whatever	you	spend	or	pledge	to	do,	
Allah is	aware	of	it;	and	the	unjust	do	not	
have	supporters.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tum	jo	 kharch	 karo	 ya	mannat	māno	
Allah	 ko	 us	 ki	 khabar	 hai	aur	 Zālimoñ	 ka	
koi	madad-gār	nahi.
